titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for Don M. Dickinson papers, 1888.
titlestmt.author: Justin Lee Tyler

repository.corpname: Detroit Public Library. Burton Historical Collection.

did.abstract: Contains copies of letters written by Grover Cleveland and a group of letters written by a member of the anti-Catholic American Protective Association.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Dickinson was Postmaster General of the U.S., and senior counsel for the U.S. before the International High Commission on the Bering Sea Claims.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Lawyer, postmaster-general, was born in Port Ontario, Oswego Co., N.Y., Jan.17, 1846. Second Michigan Democrat to rise to position of national political importance, becoming postmaster-general of the U.S., 1888-9. Was senior counsel for the U.S. before the international high Commission on the Bering Sea claims, 1896-7; member for the U.S. of a court of arbitration formed in 1902 to adjust a controversy between the U.S. and the Republic of Salvador. Died at Trenton, Mich., Oct. 15, 1917. -cf. D.A.B. Full name: Donald McDonald Dickinson. (from blue index cards)

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research use.

otherfindaid.head: Other finding aids note
otherfindaid.p: Finding aid and white index cards available in the Burton Historical Collection and on the World Wide Web.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: The following section contains a detailed listing of the materials in the collection.
